review_title: A great place to work, do research, and learn.
job_title: Linux Systems Administrator in Montreal, QC
pros: Working with postgrads and researchers from around the world makes for an energetic, dynamic team and positive growing experience. The Douglas has vast green spaces and services available for health, sports and leisure.
cons: Though the Douglas has renovated many parts of the old buildings, working in an older hospital setting with a network of underground hallways might take some time adjusting to at first if you have never worked in such a place.
No particularly that i can think off

review_title: Not a very happy place to work
job_title: Masters Student Researcher in Verdun, QC
pros: Very impactful research conducted and their brain biobank.
cons: Grossly underpaid, understaffed, many unhappy workers

review_title: Depends on the lab you join, however for the most part its good for a bit, not so much for the long term
job_title: Computational Data Scientist in Montreal, QC
pros:
Most of the employees there are really nice
Good science being done from what I've seen
cons:
Not a great salary
Employment is dependent on the lab's financial situation which may be unstable

review_title: Good people frustrating IT and communications
pros: Worked on a research project with wonderful people. Flexible work hours. I worked from home outside Quebec. Travel cost is non existent.
cons: Everything is in french since it is a Quebec employer. My pay stub is also in french. I only speak english.

pros: Nice people and cafeteria food is good
cons: Old building, not a lot of money

review_title: Great place to work at if intellectually curious
pros: The seniors are very willing and able to help on any kind of project. The environment is very friendly and stimulating.
cons: The physical aspect of the building needs renovation - looks like it comes out of an old scary movie. However the outside is very relaxing...a lot of green.

pros: Excellent learning environment. Wonderful colleagues. Reasonable flexibility in work schedule. The Douglas HOspital is situated on beautiful grounds and is environmentally conscious
cons: There are a lot of internal politics and changes to the organizational structure that has put a damper on morale. That said, I believe the situation is fixable.

pros: The research center of the Douglas hospital is amazing, collaborative, multidisciplinary and has lots of resources. I was very lucky to work with one of the best supervisors at the Douglas.
cons: Not all the supervisors (Principal Investigators) are great. You need to be very careful who you choose to work with.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Montreal, QC
pros: Friendly environment to work in. Staffs arr professional
cons: you need to be bilingual because Quebec in known for french speaking

review_title: Nice on the ouside, not in the inside
pros: Nice on the outside, good work/life balance.
cons: Old buildings, hard to work with unionized employees.

pros: Good team, good benefits and beautiful campus
cons: the new CIUSSS systems have slowed things down considerably and create some headaches.

pros: Relaxed work environment, stimulating, lots of different projects going on simultaneously
cons: Lack of long term job security

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Montreal, QC
pros: The campus is beautiful and people are nice
cons: Location is not close to downtown

pros: People, environment, Pts, expertise, cool place
cons: Mandatory Overtime, lack of organization, old, not flexible
